title: Emma Stone and ex-boyfriend Andrew Garfield share sweet embrace after bumping into each other at pre-BAFTA party
text:
Emma Stone and Andrew Garfield attends the BAFTA nominees party at Kensington Palace (Photo: Getty)   Thank you for subscribing!   
Emma Stone and ex-boyfriend Andrew Garfield shared a sweet hug as they bumped into each other at a pre-BAFTA party in London on Saturday night. 
The La La Land star and Spider-Man actor split in April 2015 following four years of on/off dating, but it's clear they still remain close friends. 
Andrew had a huge grin on his face as his ex, who was oozing glamour in an embellished black dress that featured a feather hem, wrapped an affectionate arm around his neck. 
It's little surprise he recently admitted that he's Emma's "biggest fan" and said he's thrilled to see her doing so well. Emma Stone and Andrew Garfield (Photo: Rex Features) 
Andrew - who gave Emma a standing ovation as she picked up a Golden Globe award earlier this year - said: "I'm her biggest fan as an artist. I'm constantly inspired by her work. I'm constantly inspired by how she handles and holds herself. 
"So, for me it's been bliss to be able to watch her success and watch her bloom into the actress she is." 
And the Hacksaw Ridge star admits there is still an "unconditional" bond between himself and the 28-year-old beauty. Andrew Garfield attends the BAFTA nominees party at Kensington Palace (Photo: Getty) (Photo: Getty) (Photo: REUTERS) 
Speaking on Vanity Fair's Little Gold Men podcast, he said: "We care about each other so much, and that's a given, that's kind of this unconditional thing. 
"There's so much love between us and so much respect ... It's also been wonderful to have that kind of support for each other. 
"It's nothing but a beautiful thing." 
On Saturday night, the pair were joined by a host of other famous faces. (Photo: REUTERS) (Photo: Getty) 
Amy Adams opted to wear one of the biggest trend of the awards season, keeping it fresh and simple in an off the shoulder white lace dress and black heels. (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
While British actress Thandie Newton added an injection of colour in a bold and bright halter neck dress. 
Eddie Redmayne was also in attendance with his wife Hannah Bagshawe and looked dapper in velvet trousers and a sharp overcoat. (Photo: Getty) (Photo: Getty) 
The Fall star Gillian Anderson, 48, also opted for a white ensemble made up of a form-fitting pencil skirt and eye-catching peplum top. 
The British Academy Film Awards take place at the Royal Albert Hall in London and will be presented by Stephen Fry.
